meanings.definition: A scene of uproar and confusion
meanings.sent1: The classroom was a bedlam of students talking loudly and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The city streets turned into bedlam as people rushed to catch the last bus.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party turned into a bedlam when the clown accidentally sprayed water on everyone.
meanings.sent4: The marketplace was a bedlam of colors and sounds, overwhelming the senses.
meanings.sent5: The forest at night was a bedlam of chirping crickets and rustling leaves.

meanings.definition: A place or situation of noisy uproar and confusion
meanings.sent1: The concert hall was a bedlam of excited fans cheering for their favorite band.
meanings.sent2: The emergency room was in bedlam as paramedics rushed in with injured patients.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen turned into a bedlam of clattering pots and pans as the chef prepared dinner.
meanings.sent4: The protest march was a bedlam of voices shouting slogans and waving banners.
meanings.sent5: The carnival was a bedlam of bright lights, music, and laughter.
